answers.answer: Hi there!The tablets would not make a difference to the angiography results or reverse the condition and are primarily prescribed to prevent the condition from getting worse and controlling related factors i.e. hypertension, diabetes, hypercholestremia, decrease blood coagulability to prevent clot formation etc. Ideally an angiography is advisable; however a few of the medications may need to be stopped before the test and re-started afterwards. A passive approach would be to wait for sometime for the angiography, if the ischaemia noted has been mild. However if an angiography has been advised by your doctor I would suggested getting done with it at the earliest.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: I'm M/53yrs. I used to feel short duration light stinging chest pain at varied locations mostly on left but occasionally on right side as well. On 09-Feb 2012 the lift to my office was temporarily out of order so I climbed upstairs six floors without stopping. My breathing was quite fast and I felt slight pain with burning sensation and heaviness on left side chest including up to left wrist; all became normal within few -say 5 - minutes. I went to my doctor in the evening and my BP was 160/100. Some tests were carried out and the results are as under:Blood sugar - 155/204. `SGPT -87, SGOT- 52, ALK. PHOSPHATE -152, TOTAL CHOLESTEROL - 209, TRIGLYC. - 173, HDL - 37, LDL – 141, VLDL - 34.6, CHL/HDL- 5.6, LDL/HDL - 3.8, ## GLUCOSE & PROTEIN IN URINE - NIL. ECG - VPC(VENTRICULAR PREMATURE COMPLEX, SHORT R-R INTERVALS), ABNORMAL R-WAVE PROGRESSION.....## CHEST X-RAY - NAD ## U/SOUND OF ABDOMEN - SLIGHT FATTY LIVER, REST WAS NORMAL ##  ECHO TEST  – Mild concentric LV hypertrophy , GR I diastolic dysfunction, normal systolic function, no RWMA ## TMT - PRE TEST BP 110/80. HR 103, STAND + HYPER-V. HR 100 BP 110/80. STAGE 0 -3MIN +STAGE ½ -  3 MIN+STAGE 1 - 3 MIN +STAGE 2 - 3MIN +STAGE 3 - 1MIN39 Sec  the test Process was terminated. At the end HR - 169 & BP - 200/90.. Recovery – after 3 min 14 sec HR - 113, BP - 160/90. Final Conclusion of TMT :" Stress test is positive for ischaemia##My doctor prescribed one tablet daily dose of :T-Sort H 40 (after B/fast),  Rosave F 5(after B/fast),  Clopitab A-75 (after B/fast),  Glimulin 2MF (before Lunch),  HOLD(Anti oxidant, Multi Vit, Multi mineral) , Anxit 25- before going to bed.Question: Should  I plan for angiography  in next few weeks or wait for the response of the medication I am being administered? I consulted two more doctors and the opinion is at variance regarding angiography.
title: Mr.
